translation: Hi, I’m Tan Jianfeng.
transcript: 大家好，我叫谈剑峰。

translation: My topic today may make you a little nervous.
transcript: 今天我的话题，可以让你们有点紧张。

translation: Ok, let’s get started, now.
transcript: 那咱们从现在开始就来紧张一下。

translation: Do you know him?
transcript: 先看看这位，都认识他吗？

translation: The story of Edward Snowden brings cybersecurity into our focus.
transcript: 因为斯诺登，所以大家开始知道网络安全。

translation: It really matters to us.
transcript: 其实跟我们息息相关。

translation: We used to think that security was the business of the country and the government, not the citizens.
transcript: 过去总以为安全是国家的事，政府的事，跟我们老百姓没关系。

translation: I’d like to tell you now.
transcript: 那我告诉你。

translation: It is our business, indeed.
transcript: 跟您息息相关。

translation: Here are some figures.
transcript: 那我们下面来看一组数字。

translation: Recently, the news of credit card insecurity has been spreading in WeChat Moments.
transcript: 最近朋友圈一直很火的，在传递着说信用卡不安全。

translation: You may have also seen many of such posts.
transcript: 大家有没有收到，很多吧。

translation: In particular, there is a striking headline, “A Verification Code Can Ruin You”.
transcript: 特别有一个醒目的标题，《一个验证码让你倾家荡产》。

translation: Let me tell you.
transcript: 我告诉各位。

translation: Your cellphone is not safe, because danger could come from text messages.
transcript: 各位的手机很不安全，因为手机短信不安全。

translation: Because there are telecom scams.
transcript: 因为电信诈骗。

translation: Let’s take a look at some figures released at the China Internet Conference last year.
transcript: 我们来看一组数字，是去年中国互联网大会上公布的。

translation: The direct loss of insecure phones is RMB 80.5bn, and this figure is for China alone.
transcript: 因为你的手机不安全造成的直接损失达到805亿人民币，这个数字是中国的。

translation: At the end of 2014, Interpol also released some figures, which were global.
transcript: 在2014年年底，国际刑警组织也公布了一组数字，这组数字是全球的。

translation: For the first time, this figure exceeded the global total drug sales and reached USD 3tn.
transcript: 而这个数字第一次超过全球的毒品总销量达到3万亿美金。

translation: This figure is the annual GDP of India in that year.
transcript: 这个数字是当年的印度全年的GDP。

translation: We call it “black property”.
transcript: 我们称之为黑产。

translation: Let us return to figures of China.
transcript: 来看看中国的数据。

translation: According to the latest statistics in 2016, do you know that every day, 5,000-8,000 phishing sites are updated, and every half day, the Chinese users click on them 100 million times?
transcript: 2016年最新的数据统计，你们知道每一天，钓鱼网站的更新是五千个到八千个，而每半天，中国人有啊一亿次的点击量。

translation: Feel scared?
transcript: 你害怕了吗？

translation: What kind of device do you think you’re using?
transcript: 你觉得你带着一个是什么样的设备在身上？

translation: Americans call it a time bomb, or a drug you can’t quit because all it takes is five minutes, just five minutes.
transcript: 美国人称它为一个定时炸弹，他又把它称为你戒不掉的毒品，因为五分钟，只要五分钟。

translation: Look at this sentence.
transcript: 看看这句话。

translation: In the age of big data, parents don’t necessarily know their children better than businessmen do.
transcript: 大数据时代，父母不一定比商家更连了解自己的孩子。

translation: In 2014, there was a case in the US.
transcript: 2014年有个案例，在美国。

translation: A teenage girl went to Amazon’s website in search of nail polish suitable for pregnant women, so Amazon sent her products for pregnant women based on big data analysis.
transcript: 有一个未成年的女孩，为了找怀孕时间用的指甲油，她上了逊亚马逊的网站，于是亚马逊根据大数据分析，给她送去了孕妇的产品。

translation: Amazon was sued by the girl’s parents later, and the parents won.
transcript: 后来亚马逊被这个父母告上法庭，最后胜诉了。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: When using big data, actually we expose our privacy.
transcript: 我们在利用大数据的时候，其实，很多的时候暴露的是我们的隐私。

translation: According to the latest data from Harvard University, as long as someone has your gender, age and blood type information, they can find 81.7% of your privacy without knowing your name.
transcript: 根据哈佛大学最新的数据，只要在网络上知道你的性别、年龄、血型，根本不需要知道你是叫什么名字，就能通过现在的数据里边找出你81.7%的隐私。

translation: I have drawn a watch here.
transcript: 我这里画了一只手表。

translation: I believe that many of you are using smart watches.
transcript: 很多人在用智能手表吧。

translation: In fact, there are successful cases abroad, in which hackers use data from your smart watch’s tilt angle to determine the password you entered at the ATM.
transcript: 我给大家讲一个案例，已经有成功案例，国外的黑客，通过你带的智能手腕手表，通过它的倾斜角度和数据的采集来判断出你在ATM机之前输的密码。

translation: So, is biometric verification safe?
transcript: 我们再来看看，生物认证安全吗？

translation: A lot of people now think biometric verification is safe because the "password" are our body parts.
transcript: 很多人现在都觉得生物认证很安全，因为长在我身上。

translation: Okay, answer this.
transcript: 好吧，那我问你。

translation: Do you know the worst part about biometric verification?
transcript: 你知道生物认证最不安全的地方在哪儿吗？

translation: In fact, biometric verification is not safe.
transcript: 或者说其实生物认证并不安全。

translation: Maybe you believe that it is safe because your physical characteristics are unique.
transcript: 并不像你们想象的因为是你身上唯一的，所以它安全。

translation: However, all the online identity verification is achieved through comparison.
transcript: 就是因为它是身上唯一的，它不可再生，我们所有的网络上的身份认证都是通过对比来实现的。

translation: Once that data is intercepted, it’s gone.
transcript: 当这个数据一旦被截获就没有了。

translation: If you are blessed with twelve fingers, you have two more chances than others.
transcript: 老天很眷顾你，给你十二个手指，你比别人多两次机会。

translation: But can you afford to have endless plastic surgery in South Korea?
transcript: 你有多少钱能天天让你到韩国去整容啊？

translation: Last year, a star’s house was stolen by a driver through face scanning.
transcript: 我们去年有个明星家里的房子，就是因为刷脸被司机给刷走了。

translation: Here is an offline example.
transcript: 举个线下的例子。

translation: Guys, keep your cell phone in a safe place while you’re sleeping or drinking too much.
transcript: 各位，你们睡着的时候，喝多酒的时候一定把你的手机给看牢啦。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Many phones are now powered on by fingerprints.
transcript: 因为很多手机现在都是指纹开机的。

translation: When you fall asleep or drink too much, someone else can unlock it.
transcript: 别人当你睡着和喝多的时候他就可以把它打开。

translation: What’s more, if he has malicious intentions, he/she can store his/her fingerprints on your phone, and then, he/she can check your phone at any time.
transcript: 更可怕的是，如果他有恶意他在你的手机里再存了自己的指纹，他永远可以随时看你的手机。

translation: This is offline security.
transcript: 这就是线下的安全。

translation: Security is even harder to ensure online.
transcript: 那线上更加不安全。

translation: Biometric verification is not as safe as you might think.
transcript: 所以生物认证并不是大家想象得这么安全。

translation: In fact, biometric verification should be used locally, such as your home entrance, or the armory and bank vault you see in popular American movies.
transcript: 因为生物认证真正应该使用的地方是在什么，本地化，它就是建立比如说你们家的禁门禁，比如说你在美国大片里看到的这个枪械库，银行的金库。

translation: Your fingerprints are not uploaded.
transcript: 那个时候它并不把你的指纹上传。

translation: You may ask why your fingerprints are usually collected when going abroad.
transcript: 那有人说诶为什么进到很多国家的时候都要录取指纹。

translation: That is for counter-terrorism.
transcript: 那是因为反恐的时候查找人用的。

translation: Your fingerprints will not be uploaded to the internet.
transcript: 它并不把这个指纹上传到网络。

translation: So, remember, the cyberspace is not safe.
transcript: 所以记住了网络不安全。

translation: Especially after you upload your unique biological characteristics onto the Internet, sorry, there is no security for you at all on the Internet.
transcript: 所以把你的生物这个唯一的特性传到网络里，那对不起，你没有在网络里再有真正的安全了。

translation: The future is the era of big data.
transcript: 未来是大数据的时代。

translation: The internet is inseparable from cell phones, computers and other devices that interconnect every details of our life.
transcript: 这些网都离不开手机、电脑等等等等这些连接我们每一个生活的细节的设备。

translation: People should pay attention to safety, and start from the devices around.
transcript: 大家要关注你的安全，从关注你身边的设备开始。

translation: A camera attached to an APP could make your life a live stream.
transcript: APP就像摄像头，让你生活变得像直播。

translation: Everybody’s using WeChat.
transcript: 大家都在用微信。

translation: It can figure out your friends, your friends’ friends and draw a clear map of your friend circle.
transcript: 微信能知道你朋友是谁，你朋友的朋友是谁，它能画出一个清晰的你的朋友圈的脸谱。

translation: Alibaba can analyze your income, your investments and your shopping habits.
transcript: 用阿里的，它能分析出来你的收入是什么情况，你的这个投资是什么情况，你购物的习惯是什么样。

translation: Baidu knows where you went if you are using its APP.
transcript: 用百度的，它几乎能知道你的出行。

translation: Big data brings us a lot of convenience, but we also need to remind ourselves that the convenience is achieved at the cost of exposing our privacy.
transcript: 大数据给我们带来了很多的便利，但是，我们也要提提醒自己，大数据是在出卖自己的隐私的过程中给你的便利。

translation: Security and convenience are incompatible, at least for now.
transcript: 所以安全和便捷，是不能划等号的，至少在现在。

translation: People in the cybersecurity industry have been working on it.
transcript: 而我们这些从事网络安全行业的从业者就一直在为之努力和付出。

translation: Convenience doesn’t necessarily mean security.
transcript: 所以便捷不一定给你带来安全。

translation: Convenience probably means no secrets.
transcript: 便捷很可能带来的是让你没有秘密。

translation: What we ordinary people care about the most is not the secrets, but the money in our pockets.
transcript: 而我们老百姓关心的最多的不是在于秘密，而是在于兜里的钱。

translation: Black property is now eyeing on your money, not the information in your text message.
transcript: 因为现在黑产一定盯上是你的腰包，而不是你发一条短信的信息。

translation: For hackers, there is no absolute security.
transcript: 在黑客眼里没有绝对的安全。

translation: Accidents happen all the time.
transcript: 只有你想不到的。

translation: Our real online world is actually unprotected.
transcript: 看我们这个世界，都在裸奔，这就是我们真实的网络世界。

translation: This picture is a good illustration of the current state of the internet.
transcript: 这张图，很能说明现在的网络状况。

translation: Our internet is a mirage built on a desert.
transcript: 我们的互联网，建立在沙漠之上的海市蜃楼。

translation: Internet gives us a lot of convenience, but we don’t have the control over the underlying core technology.
transcript: 因为我们现在用网络的时候我们很方便，很便捷；但是，因为我们的底层没有东西是我们自己的，我们的核心技术基本上我们都不可控制，因为我们没有。

translation: By April 20, China had been connected to the internet for exactly 22 years.
transcript: 互联网到4月20号正好满22年，中国接入互联网22年。

translation: Without core technology, we are now faced with many problems.
transcript: 我们没有核心技术，所以造成我们现在这么多的问题。

translation: On April 19, President Xi held a symposium on cybersecurity and talked about the need to strengthen the research and development of core technologies and put our products and core technologies into use.
transcript: 所以4月19号习总书记召开了网络安全的座谈会，讲到了一定要加强我们在核心技术上的研发，让我们的产品，让我们的核心技术能够被大家用。

translation: Only then can we have a chance to improve our present situation.
transcript: 只有用了才有机会改善我们现在的现状。

translation: He who knows not how to fight knows not how to defend.
transcript: 未知攻，焉知防。

translation: I’ve spent a little bit of time today talking about some really scary things.
transcript: 今天我用这个短短的时间给大家讲了前面很可怕的，听起来可能很可很可怕。

translation: I would like to give you some tips.
transcript: 那么我也讲一点，生活中小小的建议。

translation: First of all, did you bind credit cards to e-bank?
transcript: 第一个，各位在座的都在绑信用卡在网银上吧?

translation: If so, I am sorry to inform you that it is only a matter of time before your card is hacked.
transcript: 很不幸的通知您只要你绑了，你的这张卡已经不行了，没被盗只是时间问题。

translation: You may be familiar with HTTPS if you use the internet.
transcript: 我们上网的时候是不是有个HTTPS啊。

translation: The “S” part is closely related to your bank account.
transcript: 在S的时候是连接我银行的是吧，有印象吗？

translation: It is for an OppenSSL function, called Secure Socket Layer.
transcript: 这个S就是加密通道叫OppenSSL。

translation: The “Heartbleed” bug in 2014 resulted in the theft of databases from many Chinese websites, including a well-known website based in Shanghai.
transcript: 在2014年“心脏滴血”漏洞造成我们中国很多的网站数据库被盗，包括我们上海每某知名的网站。

translation: Media said that people who had booked hotel or tickets on that website should replace their credit card.
transcript: 当时媒体就通知，请大家凡是在这个网上订过酒店订过机票的请你更换信用卡。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: It’s very simple.
transcript: 很简单。

translation: Take a piece of paper and a pen, write down your credit card number and the three-digit check code.
transcript: 你拿一张纸一支笔，抄下你信用卡的卡号和你后面三位数的校验码。

translation: Take the credit card away.
transcript: 把这张信用卡收起来。

translation: Can you pay online with this paper?
transcript: 你拿这张纸你看看你能在网上支付吗?

translation: The answer is yes.
transcript: 回答是肯定的。

translation: Of course, you can.
transcript: 你能支付那一样的。

translation: Many websites record your card number and check code to provide you with convenient services.
transcript: 因为很多网络过程中，它要给你提供便捷服务，所以都在记录着你这个每一张卡的卡号和你的校验码。

translation: Recently you must hear of the news.
transcript: 而那个时候，最近你们看到新闻了。

translation: SMS verification codes are also insecure, or we should say, it is not safe at all.
transcript: 验证码，所谓的短信验证码并不安全，应该说很不安全。

translation: Here is a tip.
transcript: 注意。

translation: If you are binding a credit card to e-bank, choose one with lower quota to reduce the risk.
transcript: 大家如果再要用卡绑在你的手机网银上的时候，小窍门儿，绑一张低额的信用卡让你在被盗的时候降低风险。

translation: In fact, cybersecurity work is to reduce the risk, because risks can never be eliminated.
transcript: 其实网络安全本身就是降低风险，是不是，因为安全无绝对。

translation: In addition, I believe that many of you are using your credit card on POS terminals.
transcript: 第二个，各位你们都用信用卡去刷pos机。

translation: I suggest you cancel the password you use on POS terminal consumption.
transcript: 听完我的这个小小的演讲，取消你在pos机消费时的密码。

translation: People may ask, “Isn’t it unsafe not to have a password?”
transcript: 很多人问，没有密码不是不安全吗？

translation: I think people who have a credit card usually have a Visa or Master card as well.
transcript: 我想各位有信用卡的人一定有国外的visa或者master的卡。

translation: If you have spent some time or bought things abroad, you will find that you are only required to enter your password when swiping a UnionPay card.
transcript: 你们也一定在国外呆过，或者消费过，你会发现一件事儿，如果你刷银联卡，它就叫你输入密码。

translation: Visa or Master card consumption does not require a password, is it right?
transcript: 如果你说刷的是visa或者master你不用输入密码，是不是啊？

translation: Am I right?
transcript: 有吗？

translation: Well, what I’m trying to tell you is that it’s actually safer to not have a password.
transcript: 好，我就告诉你其实没有密码，反而是对你有保障的。

translation: And thirdly, everybody is using cell phone.
transcript: 好，第三个，很多人用手机吧。

translation: Many have two.
transcript: 很多人拥有两个手机。

translation: Let me tell you the right way to use two phones at the same time.
transcript: 我可以告诉大家两个手机正确的使用方法。

translation: I'm not talking about two internet-connected phones that handle work and personal affairs separately.
transcript: 不是你们现在用的，两个手机都能上网，两个手机都能打电话，因为为了工作方便一个私人的一个工作的或者等等。

translation: You can use one phone to surf the internet.
transcript: 其实一个手机上网。

translation: Do not put your contacts or sensitive photos in it.
transcript: 不要放通讯录，不要放你的敏感照片。

translation: And use another phone with no internet access to make calls.
transcript: 第二个手机打电话。

translation: Put your address book in the second phone.
transcript: 没有网络可以放通讯录。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: I believe that many of you have heard of the nude picture scandal of Hollywood stars. The photos were leaked in early 2015.
transcript: 2015年年初，美国好莱坞影星的艳照门大家应该知道这事儿吧。

translation: As long as your phone is connected to the internet, it can’t keep secrets.
transcript: 所以只要你的手机在联网状态下你没有秘密，你存不住东西。

translation: These three tips are to let you know that cybersecurity is a contradiction.
transcript: 我送这三个小小的提示，是为了让大家知道网络安全就是矛和盾的关系。

translation: There is no absolute safety, and there is no absolute safe technology.
transcript: 没有绝对安全，所以也没有绝对安全的技术。

translation: Technology is always ancillary.
transcript: 技术永远是辅助。

translation: Don’t assume that antivirus software will keep your computer safe.
transcript: 您不要认为你装了杀毒软件，你的电脑万无一失。

translation: It’s like the human body.
transcript: 就好比人的身体。

translation: Which appeared first, vaccines or viruses?
transcript: 你生病的时候是先有疫苗还是先有病毒啊？

translation: Therefore, technology can only be an aid.
transcript: 所以技术只能作为辅助。

translation: Promoting cybersecurity requires raising the security awareness of the whole nation.
transcript: 真正的提高网络安全保障自己的网安全，就是提高全民的安全意识。

translation: I am hoping that you can pass this to more people around you, especially the elderly.
transcript: 大家希望听过这个课，能够给大家身边的人特别是老人多宣传一下。

translation: No matter who you are, no matter it is text message or WeChat message, do not click on an unconfirmed link.
transcript: 送一个很重要的就是告诉所有身边的人，无论是谁，不管是短信，微信，给你发任何的信息，只要有链接在你没确认之下不要点。

translation: Just don't.
transcript: 千万不要点。

translation: Your phone may have been hit by a Trojan, and you just don’t know it.
transcript: 你的手机很可能就中了木马，而你没有感觉。

translation: If Trojan Horse virus is on your phone, the credit card number and password you enter will be sent to the hacker.
transcript: 而当时中了木马以后，你的手机里边输入信用卡号、输入密码的时候都会无形地向黑客服发送。

translation: After the Eighteenth National Congress of the CPC, President Xi has said: “Without cybersecurity, there is no national security. Without informationization, there will be no modernization.”
transcript: 十八大以来，我们总书记说了：“没有网络安全就没有国家安全，没有信息化就没有现代化。”

translation: Cybersecurity is the foundation.
transcript: 网络安全是放在前面的，网络安全是地基产业。

translation: Only by consolidating cybersecurity can the infinite prospect of internet development be realized.
transcript: 只有在网络安全建立的巩固的情况下，我们的互联网发展才前景无限。

translation: The road ahead is long.
transcript: 路漫漫其修远兮，我们的路还很长。

translation: We will and we have to embrace the internet, but we have to be vigilant all the time, too.
transcript: 因为我们要拥抱网络，我们必须拥抱网络，但是我们时时要敲响这个警钟。

translation: You can use the internet, but you need to be careful.
transcript: 让大家知道网络要用它，要用好它，同时你要有时时提醒自己的那一份心。

translation: Remember, your data is also your property.
transcript: 不要忘了，你的数据也是你的财产。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢大家！
